item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, December 30, 2024 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. From Pegasus to Predator – The evolution of commercial spyware on iOS [video] (202 points | 69 comments)
2. MiceWine – run Windows applications and games on Android smartphones (18 points | 2 comments)
3. Pigment Mixing into Digital Painting (259 points | 41 comments)
4. Nikon reveals a lens that captures wide and telephoto images simultaneously (63 points | 28 comments)
5. KAG – Knowledge Graph RAG Framework (91 points | 21 comments)
6. The Cody Computer (149 points | 13 comments)
7. PolyDye: Full color printer mod for Marlin 3D printers (67 points | 12 comments)
8. VW Group Collects Vehicle Movement Data (22 points | 3 comments)
9. Overloading the lambda abstraction in Haskell (2022) (28 points | 1 comment)
10. The Zombocom Problem (169 points | 41 comments)
11. 86Box: Emulator of x86-Based Machines (5 points | discuss)
12. Build a working game of Tetris in Conway's Game of Life (2014) (210 points | 21 comments)
13. Was zombie-Bench just acquired? (11 points | 1 comment)
14. Neuters: Lightweight front end to Reuters News (50 points | 21 comments)
15. Archibald Low's ‘ruthlessly imaginative’ 1925 predictions come true, mostly (36 points | 15 comments)
16. Issues with object-oriented programming in Guile (19 points | 1 comment)
17. Against the Hydraulic Analogy (9 points | 2 comments)
18. The last Inca bridge master (105 points | 21 comments)
19. Reverse Video Search (3 points | discuss)
20. Rod Serling on Doomsday (38 points | 7 comments)
21. Show HN: Chorus, a Mac app that lets you chat with a bunch of AIs at once (92 points | 34 comments)
22. Trying to use Bluesky without getting burned again (201 points | 329 comments)
23. WebGL Fluid Simulation (414 points | 54 comments)
24. The history of twisted-pair Ethernet [video] (99 points | 13 comments)
25. Is Iceland getting ready to join the EU? (254 points | 478 comments)
26. Jimmy Carter has died (1056 points | 609 comments)
27. Brave Care Has Closed (50 points | 90 comments)
28. Breaking NATO Radio Encryption [video] (122 points | 30 comments)
29. Faster CI with Selective Testing (40 points | 39 comments)
30. OpenAI’s board, paraphrased: ‘All we need is unimaginable sums of money’ (240 points | 214 comments)
